effects: Expire Max Health Restored per Second: 20%
Expire Max Mana Restored per Second: 20%
notes: Reincarnation cannot be prevented in any way. If a hero dies with it, it is used. If the wielder has a Reincarnation ability, the ability triggers first if it is usable.
Revives with full health and mana. Spells and items are not refreshed.
Provides 1800/800 ground vision at the death location during its delay.

When Roshan reclaims the Aegis, the wielding hero is granted health and mana regeneration for a short duration. Can regenerate up to 100% of the hero's max health and mana over its full duration. The hero's max health and mana are checked periodically and the values adapted instantly.
Damage greater than 0 from any player (including allies, excluding self) or Roshan dispels the effect. Does not get dispelled by damage flagged as HP Removal.
abilities.description: Brings you to life with full health and mana 5 seconds after you die, at the location where you died. Reincarnation must be used within 5 minutes or Aegis of the Immortal disappears. If it expires, it will heal you over 5 seconds (dispels on damage).

description: The Immortal was said to own a shield that protected him from death itself.
trivia: Aegis was previously an ordinary recipe item that contained three charges. After it was removed, it was then obtainable as a droppable item from Roshan.
In Greek mythology, an aegis that was described as "ageless and immortal" was presented to Zeus.
info: The Aegis of the Immortal cannot be dropped or sold.

The Aegis disappears when one of the following happens, be it in a player's inventory, or still on the ground where Roshan dropped it: Roshan respawns 8–11 minutes after being slain. The Aegis wielder dies and reincarnates, using up the Aegis. Five minutes pass since the Aegis was picked up by a hero. This means it is impossible for multiple Aegis to exist in a match.
